member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection
member.summary: A connection used to invoke hub methods on a SignalR Server.
member.remarks: A should be created using . Before hub methods can be invoked the connection must be started using . Clean up a connection using or .

member.name: E:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.Closed
member.summary: Occurs when the connection is closed. The connection could be closed due to an error or due to either the server or client intentionally closing the connection without error.
member.remarks: If this event was triggered from a connection error, the that occurred will be passed in as the sole argument to this handler. If this event was triggered intentionally by either the client or server, then the argument will be .

member.name: E:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.Reconnecting
member.summary: Occurs when the starts reconnecting after losing its underlying connection.
member.remarks: The that occurred will be passed in as the sole argument to this handler.

member.name: E:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.Reconnected
member.summary: Occurs when the successfully reconnects after losing its underlying connection.
member.remarks: The parameter will be the 's new ConnectionId or null if negotiation was skipped.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.ServerTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the server timeout interval for the connection.
member.remarks: The client times out if it hasn't heard from the server for `this` long.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval at which the client sends ping messages.
member.remarks: Sending any message resets the timer to the start of the interval.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.HandshakeTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for the initial handshake.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.ConnectionId
member.summary: Gets the connection's current Id. This value will be cleared when the connection is stopped and will have a new value every time the connection is (re)established. This value will be null if the negotiation step is skipped via HttpConnectionOptions or if the WebSockets transport is explicitly specified because the client skips negotiation in that case as well.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.State
member.summary: Indicates the state of the to the server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.#ctor(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Connections.IConnectionFactory,Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.IHubProtocol,System.Net.EndPoint,System.IServiceProvider,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILoggerFactory,Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.IRetryPolicy)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The used to create a connection each time is called.
An containing the services provided to this instance.
The that controls the timing and number of reconnect attempts. The will not reconnect if the is null.
member.remarks: The used to initialize the connection will be disposed when the connection is disposed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.#ctor(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Connections.IConnectionFactory,Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Protocol.IHubProtocol,System.Net.EndPoint,System.IServiceProvider,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILoggerFactory)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The used to create a connection each time is called.
An containing the services provided to this instance.
member.remarks: The used to initialize the connection will be disposed when the connection is disposed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.StartAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Starts a connection to the server.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous start.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.StopAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Stops a connection to the server.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous stop.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.DisposeAsync
member.summary: Disposes the .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous dispose.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.On(System.String,System.Type[],System.Func{System.Object[],System.Object,System.Threading.Tasks.Task},System.Object)
member.summary: Registers a handler that will be invoked when the hub method with the specified method name is invoked.
member.param: The name of the hub method to define.
The parameters types expected by the hub method.
The handler that will be raised when the hub method is invoked.
A state object that will be passed to the handler.
member.returns: A subscription that can be disposed to unsubscribe from the hub method.
member.remarks: This is a low level method for registering a handler. Using an On extension method is recommended.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes all handlers associated with the method with the specified method name.
member.param: The name of the hub method from which handlers are being removed

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.StreamAsChannelCoreAsync(System.String,System.Type,System.Object[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Invokes a streaming hub method on the server using the specified method name, return type and arguments.
member.param: The name of the server method to invoke.
The return type of the server method.
The arguments used to invoke the server method.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous invoke. The property returns a for the streamed hub method values.
member.remarks: This is a low level method for invoking a streaming hub method on the server. Using an StreamAsChannelAsync extension method is recommended.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.InvokeCoreAsync(System.String,System.Type,System.Object[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Invokes a hub method on the server using the specified method name, return type and arguments.
member.param: The name of the server method to invoke.
The return type of the server method.
The arguments used to invoke the server method.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous invoke. The property returns an for the hub method return value.
member.remarks: This is a low level method for invoking a hub method on the server. Using an InvokeAsync extension method is recommended.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.SendCoreAsync(System.String,System.Object[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Invokes a hub method on the server using the specified method name and arguments. Does not wait for a response from the receiver.
member.param: The name of the server method to invoke.
The arguments used to invoke the server method.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous invoke.
member.remarks: This is a low level method for invoking a hub method on the server. Using an SendAsync extension method is recommended.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnection.StreamAsyncCore``1(System.String,System.Object[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Invokes a streaming hub method on the server using the specified method name, return type and arguments.
member.typeparam: The return type of the streaming server method.
member.param: The name of the server method to invoke.
The arguments used to invoke the server method.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the stream.

member.summary: A builder for configuring instances.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnectionBuilderExtensions.ConfigureLogging(Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.IHubConnectionBuilder,System.Action{Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILoggingBuilder})
member.summary: Adds a delegate for configuring the provided . This may be called multiple times.
member.returns: The same instance of the for chaining.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnectionBuilderExtensions.WithAutomaticReconnect(Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.IHubConnectionBuilder)
member.summary: Configures the to automatically attempt to reconnect if the connection is lost. The client will wait the default 0, 2, 10 and 30 seconds respectively before trying up to four reconnect attempts.
member.returns: The same instance of the for chaining.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnectionBuilderExtensions.WithAutomaticReconnect(Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.IHubConnectionBuilder,System.TimeSpan[])
member.summary: Configures the to automatically attempt to reconnect if the connection is lost.
member.param: An array containing the delays before trying each reconnect attempt. The length of the array represents how many failed reconnect attempts it takes before the client will stop attempting to reconnect.
member.returns: The same instance of the for chaining.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.HubConnectionBuilderExtensions.WithAutomaticReconnect(Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.IHubConnectionBuilder,Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.IRetryPolicy)
member.summary: Configures the to automatically attempt to reconnect if the connection is lost.
member.param: An that controls the timing and number of reconnect attempts.
member.returns: The same instance of the for chaining.

member.summary: Creates a .

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.IRetryPolicy
member.summary: An abstraction that controls when the client attempts to reconnect and how many times it does so.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.IRetryPolicy.NextRetryDelay(Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.RetryContext)
member.summary: If passed to , this will be called after the trasnport loses a connection to determine if and for how long to wait before the next reconnect attempt.
member.param: Information related to the next possible reconnect attempt including the number of consecutive failed retries so far, time spent reconnecting so far and the error that lead to this reconnect attempt.
member.returns: A representing the amount of time to wait from now before starting the next reconnect attempt. tells the client to stop retrying and close.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.RetryContext
member.summary: The context passed to to help the policy determine how long to wait before the next retry and whether there should be another retry at all.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.RetryContext.PreviousRetryCount
member.summary: The number of consecutive failed retries so far.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.RetryContext.ElapsedTime
member.summary: The amount of time spent retrying so far.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Client.RetryContext.RetryReason
member.summary: The error precipitating the current retry if any.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Internal.AsyncEnumerableAdapters.CancelableAsyncEnumerable`1
member.summary: Converts an IAsyncEnumerable of T to an IAsyncEnumerable of object.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.ForceAsyncTaskExtensions.ForceAsync(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Returns an awaitable/awaiter that will ensure the continuation is executed asynchronously on the thread pool, even if the task is already completed by the time the await occurs. Effectively, it is equivalent to awaiting with ConfigureAwait(false) and then queuing the continuation with Task.Run, but it avoids the extra hop if the continuation already executed asynchronously.
